item.title: Overview
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5 { text-align: center; } Open-Source Software Team Page Current economic indicators and indicators developed by the National Center for Science & Engineering Statistics (NCSES) do not measure the value of goods and services that fall outside of market transactions. Although NCSES does track some types of software development, it is challenging to account for open-source software (OSS) outputs because these products are largely being advanced outside of traditional business contexts.

item.title: Overview
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. item.title: Packages
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5 { text-align: center; } GHOST.jl GHOST.jl, short for GitHub Open-Source Tracker, is a Julia package for targeted scraping of GitHub user and activity data tidyorgs tidyorgs is an R package that detects and standardizes organizations in unstructured text data diverstidy diverstidy is an R package designed for detection and standardization of geographic, population, and diversity-related terminology in unstructured text data

item.title: Presentations
Projects
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5 { text-align: center; } Current Projects Robbins, C., Korkmaz, G., Calderon, J.B.S., and Kramer, B.L. “Measuring the Cost of Open Source Software Innovation on GitHub.” Draft Available. [GitHub Repo.] Open Source Software (OSS), defined by Open Source Initiative, is computer software with its source code shared with a license in which the copyright holder provides the rights to study, change, and distribute the software to anyone and for any purpose.
